title: Oxfordshire Live: Friday 19 August - BBC News
summary: model aircraft battery sparks garage fire .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for reading today , please join us again on monday at 08:00 for news , sport , travel and weather from around oxfordshire .

documents.title: picture left in wardrobe for years sold for £ 9,500
text: a painting bought by an oxford professor and then left in the back of a wardrobe for years after he gave it away has sold for £ 9,500 at auction .
it was discovered to be a rare work by british artist euan uglow , whose work has become highly sought after in recent years , according to art experts .

documents.title: warning as winds of up to 50mph could rip through oxfordshire tomorrow
text: winds of up to 50mph could be set to rip through the county tomorrow .
the met office has issued a yellow weather warning for wind for oxfordshire lasting from 2am to 9pm on saturday .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: repair work starting at frideswide square on monday
text: minor repair work taking place at frideswide sq for next 2 weeks from monday # oxtravel
has n't work not long been completed there ?
is the repair needed due to poor quality of construction or some other damage ?

documents.title: woman accused of oxford stabbing has plea hearing postponed
text: a woman charged with causing grievous bodily harm with intent after a man was stabbed in oxford has had her plea hearing postponed .
gemma rees , 26 , of broom place , barton , will appear at oxford crown court on monday for a plea and trial preparation hearing .
it comes after a man in his 50s was stabbed in his home in henry taunt close , barton , on 2 july .

documents.title: ashmolean 's 1935 photo of the uffington white horse
text: uffington white horse , 1935 by major george allen , one of the first in oxfordshire to own a plane # worldphotoday
@ twitterid lovely walk up there .

documents.title: oxford united sign defender on loan
text: # oufc oxford united sign right-back phil edwards on a season long loan from burton albion .
more on
seems like a good signing .
let 's hope so !

documents.title: man wanted after breaking prison release conditions
text: david french , 32 , is being hunted by police after failing to attend appointments following his release from prison .
he was last seen on 15 july in edmonds road , banbury , and is known to frequent the banbury area .
french is white , 5ft 10ins , of broad build with cropped brown hair .
he has a birthmark on the left side of his neck .
det sgt lee newman said anyone who sees french should `` not approach him '' and `` contact police as a matter of urgency '' .

documents.title: oxford bus company reports traffic delays
text: due to traffic delays , heathrow service from oxford is currently operating every 30 min .
lhr coaches will depart oxford at 16:00 and 16:30 .

text: burton 's edwards joins oxford on loan

text: oxfordshire 's big picture

documents.title: men hunted after woman with children robbed in park
text: police are appealing for witnesses following a robbery in oxford 's christ church meadow park .
it happened on sunday between 18:00 and 18:30 when a woman was walking with her two children and two men approached her from behind .
the victim was grabbed and cash was stolen .
the men are described as arabic , in their 20s , about 5ft 8ins to 5ft 10ins , with beards .

documents.title: five things from bbc oxford this week
text: it 's time to catch up on some of the most memorable and popular news stories for oxfordshire this past week in case you missed them .

text: # oufc oxford united defender curtis nelson has ligament damage in his foot and is set to be out for at least 4wks
have we bought a load of crocks ?
nelson , hall and ribiero , whats happened to medicals and insurance .
@ oufcofficial

documents.title: oxford united : ryan taylor confident goals will come
text: oxford united striker ryan taylor says he 's confident the goals will come as he waits to get off the mark for the new season .
after suffering with a groin problem which eventually required surgery last season , he says he 's now going the extra mile to increase his sharpness in front of goal .
i 've been staying behind to practice which will help .
i 'm feeling good about my game so the goals will definitely come .

documents.title: 80s fans descend on henley for rewind festival
text: campers are descending on henley-on-thames today for a weekend-long celebration of all things 80s .
the rewind festival is back , with rick astley , tony hadley and erasure 's andy bell among the headline acts .

documents.title: today 's weather forecast
text: bee tucker gives you the latest weather .

documents.title: councils criticised over 'dead ' devolution plans
text: councils in oxfordshire have been accused of a `` turf war '' over devolution plans that have now been abandoned .
about £ 200,000 was spent by the local authorities on two rival reports on how to restructure the county 's services .
the five district councils ' recommended creating three new unitary authorities for the county , while the county council argued in favour of one .
both sides have been told by the government they need to reach a consensus .

documents.title: mother of missing didcot power station demolition worker speaks of agonising wait for his body to be recovered
text: the grieving mother of a man trapped in the wreckage of the collapsed boiler house at didcot power station has spoken of her pain over the length of time it is taking to recover his body .
author: Oxford Times

documents.title: painting stuffed in wardrobe worth £ 15,000
text: a painting bought by an oxford professor in the 1980s for £ 200 and then stuck in the back of a wardrobe is expected to reach around £ 15,000 at auction later .
james campbell , a professor of medieval history at worcester college , bought the - a view of rooftops in lowestoft - but gave it away to his cousin .
not liking the she put it in the back of a wardrobe decided to get it valued after the professor 's death earlier this year .
it was discovered to be a rare work by euan uglow , whose works have fetched up to £ 600,000 .

documents.title: little girl 's plea to council bosses 'please do n't ruin our peaceful village '
text: a nine-year-old girl has pleaded with council bosses not to destroy `` the special , peaceful '' village she loves .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: weather : cloudy with outbreaks of rain , then clearing by the evening
text: today will start cloudy , with outbreaks of rain throughout the day .
rain will ease off towards evening with some brighter spells possible .
it 'll be breezier than of late , too .
highs of 20c ( 68f ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: model aircraft battery sparks garage fire
text: paramedics had to treat a man for smoke inhalation yesterday after a fire broke out in the garage of a bungalow in thame .
he 'd breathed in the smoke while trying to remove dangerous hazards from the building in chestnut avenue .
the fire started when a battery for a model aircraft that was charging in the garage overheated , oxfordshire fire and rescue service said .

documents.title: travel latest : m40 lane closure ends
text: our roads are reasonably clear so far this morning .
the earlier lane closure on the m40 near banbury has now ended .
get up-to-the minute details on this and the rest of the county 's travel news on the bbc travel site or follow @ bbcoxtravel .
# m40 : all lanes open southbound between j12 , # gaydon and j11 , # banbury

documents.title: welcome to oxfordshire live
text: good morning to you all and a happy friday .
it 's nearly the weekend , so we 'll guide you gently into the end of the working week with all the latest headlines from around the county through to 18:00 .
do n't forget to let us know what 's going on in your area via email , facebook or twitter .
